intro: Isometrum nanchuanicum, commonly known as the Nanchuan bellflower, is a perennial herb native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous areas and thrives in well-drained soils. Its leaves are lanceolate and often covered with fine hairs. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
